item.title: Jess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jess add a quote by David McCullough
item.description: "Once upon a time in the dead of winter in the Dakota Territory, Theodore Roosevelt took off in a makeshift boat down the Little Missouri River in pursuit of a couple of thieves who had stolen his prized rowboat. After several days on the river, he caught up and got the draw on them with his trusty Winchester, at which point they surrendered. Then Roosevelt set off in a borrowed wagon to haul the thieves cross-country to justice. They headed across the snow-covered wastes of the Badlands to the railhead at Dickinson, and Roosevelt walked the whole way, the entire 40 miles. It was an astonishing feat, what might be called a defining moment in Roosevelt’s eventful life. But what makes it especially memorable is that during that time, he managed to read all of <i>Anna Karenina</i>. I often think of that when I hear people say they haven’t time to read." -- David McCullough

item.title: Jess add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "It was the look you get when facing a sudden and insurmountable danger: the errant truck, the shaky ladder, the crazy person who pins you to the linoleum and insists, with increasing urgency, that everything you know and love can be undone by a grape." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Jess add a quote by E.L. Konigsburg
item.description: "Claudia knew that she could never pull off the old-fashioned kind of running away. That is, running away in the heat of anger with a knapsack on her pack. She didn't like discomfort; even picnics were untidy and inconvenient: all those insects and the sun melting the icing on the cupcakes. Therefore, she decided that her leaving home would not be just running from somewhere but would be running to somewhere." -- E.L. Konigsburg

item.title: Jess add a quote by Wynton Marsalis
item.description: "And that's the soulful thing about playing: you offer something to somebody. You don't know if they'll like it, but you offer it." -- Wynton Marsalis

item.title: Jess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "The road to hell is paved with adverbs." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jess add a quote by Tina Fey
item.description: "To say I’m an overrated troll, when you have never even seen me guard a bridge, is patently unfair." -- Tina Fey

item.title: Jess add a quote by Augusten Burroughs
item.description: "I used to feel so alone in the city. All those gazillions of people and then me, on the outside. Because how do you meet a new person? I was very stunned by this for many years. And then I realized, you just say, "Hi." They may ignore you. Or you may marry them. And that possibility is worth that one word." -- Augusten Burroughs

item.title: Jess add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "When someone is crying, of course, the noble thing to do is to comfort them. But if someone is trying to hide their tears, it may also be noble to pretend you do not notice them." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Jess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have been unavoidably detained by the world. Expect us when you see us." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jess add a quote by Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
item.description: "An Angel who did not so much Fall as Saunter Vaguely Downwards." -- Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jess add a quote by Gail Carriger
item.description: "Lord Akeldama sighed. 'You lovebirds, how will I endure such flirtations constantly in my company? How déclassé, Lord Maccon, to love your own wife." -- Gail Carriger

item.title: Jess add a quote by Markus Zusak
item.description: "He was tall and abrupt and exactly the kind of guy you wanted to be walking the streets with." -- Markus Zusak

item.title: Jess add a quote by Meg Rosoff
item.description: "The soldier had stamped my passport FAMILY in heavy black capital letters and I checked it now for reassurance and because I liked how fierce the word looked" -- Meg Rosoff

item.title: Jess add a quote by Meg Rosoff
item.description: "I don't get nearly enough credit in life for the things I manage not to say." -- Meg Rosoff

item.title: Jess add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "She looks just as music sounds, I think,' answered Anne." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Jess add a quote by Janet Evanovich
item.description: "Why do you gotta be going somewhere? Seems like it should be enough that we had nachos. And we got meaningful jobs. We catch bad guys. If it wasn't for us, there'd be vampires and all kinds of shit running around loose." -- Janet Evanovich

item.title: Jess add a quote by Bryan Lee O'Malley
item.description: "Let's be friends based on mutual hate." -- Bryan Lee O'Malley

item.title: Jess add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "Everyone is happier if they have someone else to look down on, as well as someone to look up to, especially if they resent both." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Jess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "I will be brave, thought Coraline. No, I am brave." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jess add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"I'm not a drug salesman. I'm a writer."
"What makes you think a writer isn't a drug salesman?" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jess add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "You were her way here, and it's a dangerous thing to be a door." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jess add a quote by Raymond Carver
item.description: "But I can hardly sit still. I keep fidgeting, crossing one leg and then the other. I feel like I could throw off sparks, or break a window--maybe rearrange all the furniture." -- Raymond Carver

item.title: Jess add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "Can I be blunt on this subject? If you don't have time to read, you don't have the time (or the tools) to write. Simple as that." -- Stephen King

item.title: Jess add a quote by Don DeLillio
item.description: "Sometimes I see something so moving I know I’m not supposed to linger. See it and leave. If you stay too long, you wear out the wordless shock. Love it and trust it and leave." -- Don DeLillio

item.title: Jess add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "And I like large parties. They’re so intimate. At small parties there isn’t any privacy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jess add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "The sofa was lumpy enough to have had a body sewed into it; stuffing spilled out of the arms where the victim had tried to escape." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Jess add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "That's a horrible plan." "Yes, but I have chosen to ignore that." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Jess add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "I've become like one of those people I hate, the sort who go to the museum and, instead of looking at the magnificent Brueghel, take a picture of it, reducing it from art to proof. It's not "Look what Brueghel did, painted this masterpiece" but "Look what I did, went to Rotterdam and stood in front of a Brueghel painting!" -- David Sedaris

item.title: Jess add a quote by Molly Harper
item.description: "This is not how people behave in a Cracker Barrel!" -- Molly Harper
